title: me by section 5 of the Road Traffic Act 1961 (No. 24 of 1961) and section 17
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic Act 2010
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic Act 2010 

(Sections 15 and 17) (Prescribed Forms) (Amendment) Regulations 2020. 

(2) These Regulations come into operation on 1 October 2020.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited road traffic act 2010 (sections 15 17) (prescribed forms) (amendment) regulation 2020 (2) regulation come operation 1 october 2020

title: me by section 5 of the Road Traffic Act 1961 (No. 24 of 1961) and section 17
heading: 2. The Road Traffic Act 2010 (Sections 15 and 17) (Prescribed Forms)
text_raw:
2. The Road Traffic Act 2010 (Sections 15 and 17) (Prescribed Forms) 

Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 540 of 2011) are amended – 

(a) by the substitution of the following Regulation for Regulation 5: 

“5. The form set out in Part 2 of Schedule 2 is the prescribed 
form of certificate for the purposes of section 17 of the Act of 
2010 to certify- 

(a) 

(b) 

the presence of a drug or drugs, and 

the concentration of a drug or drugs.”, 

(b) by the deletion of Regulation 6 (inserted by Regulation 2(a) of the 
Road Traffic Act 2010 (Sections 15 and 17) (Prescribed Forms) 
(Amendment) Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 151 of 2017)), 

and 

(c) 

in Schedule 2, by the substitution for Part 2 and Part 3 (inserted 
by Regulation 2(b) of the Road Traffic Act 2010 (Sections 15 and 
17) (Prescribed Forms) (Amendment) Regulations 2017 of the 
text set out in the Schedule. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 2nd October, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [385] 3 

Schedule 

“Part 2 

Page x of x 

 Bureau Number : 

Certificate issued by the Medical Bureau of Road Safety under section 17 of the 
Road Traffic Act, 2010, certifying the presence and/or the concentration of a 
drug or drugs. Deimhniú arna eisiúint ag an Lia-Bhiúró um Shábháilteacht ar 
Bhóithre faoi alt 17 den Acht um Thrácht ar Bhóithre, 2010, á dheimhniú go 
bhfuil agus/nó ina ndeimhnítear cion druga nó drugaí. 

Particulars relating to specimen received for analysis, as shown on the form 
completed by designated doctor or designated nurse/ Sonraí a bhaineann le 
sampla arna fháil lena anailísiú, mar a thaispeántar ar an bhfoirm arna 
comhlánú ag an dochtúir ainmnithe nó ag an altra ainmnithe

title: me by section 5 of the Road Traffic Act 1961 (No. 24 of 1961) and section 17
heading: 6. Specimen forwarded from (if taken or provided in a hospital)/
text_raw:
6. Specimen forwarded from (if taken or provided in a hospital)/ 

 Sampla curtha ar aghaidh ó (i gcás a tógadh nó a soláthraíodh in 
ospidéal): 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [385] 

The Medical Bureau of Road Safety certifies that on analysis by the 
Bureau the specimen to which the above particulars relate 
contained/Deimhníonn an Lia-Bhiúró um Shábháilteacht ar Bhóithre tar 
éis don Bhiúró anailís a dhéanamh, go raibh, sa sampla lena mbaineann na 
sonraí thuas 

Signature of analyst/Síniú an anailísí__________________________ 
Date/Dáta ______________ 

This certificate is issued under section 17 of the Road Traffic Act, 2010. 

Eisítear an deimhniú seo faoi alt 17 den Acht um Thrácht ar Bhóithre, 2010. 

The Seal of the Medical Bureau of Road Safety was affixed hereto this 

Greamaíodh Séala an Lia-Bhiúró um Shábháilteacht ar Bhóithre de seo ar 
an 

____ day of/lá seo de _____________ in the presence of/i láthair 
_________________________ 

Director or Deputy Director of the Bureau/Stiúrthóir nó Leas-Stiúrthóir an 
Bhiúró 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

29 September, 2020. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for Transport.

title: me by section 5 of the Road Traffic Act 1961 (No. 24 of 1961) and section 17
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide for a new drug testing form, allowing the presence 
and the concentration of drugs to be recorded together on a single document. 

 
 
 
 
 
 6 [385]
